definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: The new pavilion old sad, tearful eyes, drizzly rain more wine.
sentences.chinese: 故國傷心，新亭淚眼，更酒瀟瀟雨。

sentences.english: Women love to cry, eyes like water.
sentences.chinese: 女人愛哭，淚眼就像水珠。

sentences.english: Getting involved in power struggles with your child will end up with tears from someone or maybe both of you.
sentences.chinese: 與孩子做鬥爭最後會以一方甚或雙方的淚眼而告終。

sentences.english: On hospital bed, Her tearful eyes dance gazed at him, Therefore they are married.
sentences.chinese: 病牀上，她淚眼婆娑的注視著他，於是，他們結婚了。

sentences.english: I think there were tears in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我猜，當時女郎一定淚眼汪汪了吧。

sentences.english: Brimming with tears, she looked deeply unhappy.
sentences.chinese: 她淚眼汪汪，顯得十分不快。

sentences.english: I think I'm misting up already.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我已經有點淚眼朦朧了。

sentences.english: All kinds of worries beset her while vaguely she was reading his letter.
sentences.chinese: 她淚眼模糊地讀着薩愛德的來信，被千愁萬緒困擾着。

sentences.english: With tear-filled, blurry eyes, I turned the TV off.
sentences.chinese: 關上電視機，我已經淚眼朦朧。

sentences.english: Let's not get misty-eyed about a new age of Sino-American cooperation here.
sentences.chinese: 請不要爲中美合作的新時代而感動得淚眼汪汪。

sentences.english: When a female has tears in her eyes, the one who cannot see is the male
sentences.chinese: 女性淚眼矇矓之時，視線受阻的是男性。

sentences.english: Wet eye dim moonlight, also only I a person only.
sentences.chinese: 淚眼昏黃時，也只有莪一小我私人而已。

sentences.english: I reached out to hug Mike through my tears.
sentences.chinese: 我淚眼朦朧地伸出雙臂擁抱了邁克。

sentences.english: With her eyes be dimmed with tears, Mary stumbled along in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 瑪莉淚眼蒙朧，在黑暗中蹣跚而行。

sentences.english: Ardo looked up through the blur of his tears.
sentences.chinese: 阿多淚眼朦朧地擡頭看着她。

sentences.english: When a female has tears in her eyes, the one who cannot see is the male.
sentences.chinese: 女性淚眼矇矓之時，視線受阻的是男性。

definition: to fall and wither (like autumn leaves)/(fig.) drifting and homeless
to chat with a low voice
